pullRequest.title: [CDAP-16249] Show dropped field operation in field level lineage UI
pullRequest.bodyText:
JIRA: https://issues.cask.co/browse/CDAP-16249
Build: https://builds.cask.co/browse/CDAP-UDUT510-1
Currently, FLL breaks if the UI gets a response from the backend with a non-existent cause of impact dataset, i.e. if a field is dropped. Also, target fields where the only operation is being dropped don't have the options to see operations because "View impact" is disabled.
This PR fixes the UI to show the lineage even when fields are dropped, and also lets users see operations for fields that are dropped (and have no other lineage/operations).
Sample pipeline (BQ to Avro) and csv are included. Pipeline uses Wrangler to drop a single field from airports.csv in BQ.

beforeCommit.message: Include info about incoming and outgoing ops for target fields and use to show existing operations

afterCommit.message:
Update parsing of backend response to include fieldcount for cause and impact datasets

Change shape of causeSets, impactSets, activeCauseSets, activeImpactSets to include fieldcount in information about each table

Include info about incoming and outgoing ops for target fields and use to show existing operations
